info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 4:07PM CDT until May 3 at 3:32AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in San Angelo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Clear Fork Brazos River Near Fort Griffin affecting Shackelford and Throckmorton Counties.
For the Clear Fork Brazos River...including Roby, Hawley, Nugent, Fort Griffin...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Clear Fork Brazos River near Fort Griffin.
* WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 31.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 39.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 38.9 feet on 10/21/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
